00057 #include "BLI_utildefines.h"
00058 
00059 #include "bmesh.h"
00060 #include "intern/bmesh_private.h"
00061 
00062 /* ok, I'm going to write a little docgen script. so all
00063  * bmop comments must conform to the following template/rules:
00064  *
00065  * template (py quotes used because nested comments don't work
00066  * on all C compilers):
00067  *
00068  * """
00069  * Region Extend.
00070  *
00071  * paragraph1, Extends bleh bleh bleh.
00072  * Bleh Bleh bleh.
00073  *
00074  * Another paragraph.
00075  *
00076  * Another paragraph.
00077  * """
00078  *
00079  * so the first line is the "title" of the bmop.
00080  * subsequent line blocks separated by blank lines
00081  * are paragraphs.  individual descriptions of slots
00082  * would be extracted from comments
00083  * next to them, e.g.
00084  *
00085  * {BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "geomout"}, //output slot, boundary region
00086  *
00087  * the doc generator would automatically detect the presence of "output slot"
00088  * and flag the slot as an output.  the same happens for "input slot".  also
00089  * note that "edges", "faces", "verts", "loops", and "geometry" are valid
00090  * substitutions for "slot".
00091  *
00092  * note that slots default to being input slots.
00093  */
00094 
00095 /*
00096  * Vertex Smooth
00097  *
00098  * Smooths vertices by using a basic vertex averaging scheme.
00099  */
00100 static BMOpDefine bmo_vertexsmooth_def = {
00101     "vertexsmooth",
00102     {{BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "verts"}, //input vertices
00103      {BMO_OP_SLOT_BOOL, "mirror_clip_x"}, //set vertices close to the x axis before the operation to 0
00104      {BMO_OP_SLOT_BOOL, "mirror_clip_y"}, //set vertices close to the y axis before the operation to 0
00105      {BMO_OP_SLOT_BOOL, "mirror_clip_z"}, //set vertices close to the z axis before the operation to 0
00106      {BMO_OP_SLOT_FLT, "clipdist"}, //clipping threshod for the above three slots
00107     {0} /* null-terminating sentinel */,
00108     },
00109     bmo_vertexsmooth_exec,
00110     0
00111 };
00112 
00113 /*
00114  * Right-Hand Faces
00115  *
00116  * Computes an "outside" normal for the specified input faces.
00117  */
00118 
00119 static BMOpDefine bmo_righthandfaces_def = {
00120     "righthandfaces",
00121     {{BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "faces"},
00122      {BMO_OP_SLOT_BOOL, "do_flip"}, //internal flag, used by bmesh_rationalize_normals
00123      {0} /* null-terminating sentinel */,
00124     },
00125     bmo_righthandfaces_exec,
00126     BMO_OP_FLAG_UNTAN_MULTIRES,
00127 };
00128 
00129 /*
00130  * Region Extend
00131  *
00132  * used to implement the select more/less tools.
00133  * this puts some geometry surrounding regions of
00134  * geometry in geom into geomout.
00135  *
00136  * if usefaces is 0 then geomout spits out verts and edges,
00137  * otherwise it spits out faces.
00138  */
00139 static BMOpDefine bmo_regionextend_def = {
00140     "regionextend",
00141     {{BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "geom"}, //input geometry
00142      {BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "geomout"}, //output slot, computed boundary geometry.
00143      {BMO_OP_SLOT_BOOL, "constrict"}, //find boundary inside the regions, not outside.
00144      {BMO_OP_SLOT_BOOL, "use_faces"}, //extend from faces instead of edges
00145      {0} /* null-terminating sentinel */,
00146     },
00147     bmo_regionextend_exec,
00148     0
00149 };
00150 
00151 /*
00152  * Edge Rotate
00153  *
00154  * Rotates edges topologically.  Also known as "spin edge" to some people.
00155  * Simple example: [/] becomes [|] then [\].
00156  */
00157 static BMOpDefine bmo_edgerotate_def = {
00158     "edgerotate",
00159     {{BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "edges"}, //input edges
00160      {BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "edgeout"}, //newly spun edges
00161      {BMO_OP_SLOT_BOOL, "ccw"}, //rotate edge counter-clockwise if true, othewise clockwise
00162      {0} /* null-terminating sentinel */,
00163     },
00164     bmo_edgerotate_exec,
00165     BMO_OP_FLAG_UNTAN_MULTIRES
00166 };
00167 
00168 /*
00169  * Reverse Faces
00170  *
00171  * Reverses the winding (vertex order) of faces.  This has the effect of
00172  * flipping the normal.
00173  */
00174 static BMOpDefine bmo_reversefaces_def = {
00175     "reversefaces",
00176     {{BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "faces"}, //input faces
00177      {0} /* null-terminating sentinel */,
00178     },
00179     bmo_reversefaces_exec,
00180     BMO_OP_FLAG_UNTAN_MULTIRES,
00181 };

00183 /*
00184  * Edge Bisect
00185  *
00186  * Splits input edges (but doesn't do anything else).
00187  * This creates a 2-valence vert.
00188  */
00189 static BMOpDefine bmo_edgebisect_def = {
00190     "edgebisect",
00191     {{BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "edges"}, //input edges
00192      {BMO_OP_SLOT_INT, "numcuts"}, //number of cuts
00193      {BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "outsplit"}, //newly created vertices and edges
00194      {0} /* null-terminating sentinel */,
00195     },
00196     bmo_edgebisect_exec,
00197     BMO_OP_FLAG_UNTAN_MULTIRES
00198 };

00200 /*
00201  * Mirror
00202  *
00203  * Mirrors geometry along an axis.  The resulting geometry is welded on using
00204  * mergedist.  Pairs of original/mirrored vertices are welded using the mergedist
00205  * parameter (which defines the minimum distance for welding to happen).
00206  */
00207 
00208 static BMOpDefine bmo_mirror_def = {
00209     "mirror",
00210     {{BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "geom"}, //input geometry
00211      {BMO_OP_SLOT_MAT, "mat"}, //matrix defining the mirror transformation
00212      {BMO_OP_SLOT_FLT, "mergedist"}, //maximum distance for merging.  does no merging if 0.
00213      {BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "newout"}, //output geometry, mirrored
00214      {BMO_OP_SLOT_INT,         "axis"}, //the axis to use, 0, 1, or 2 for x, y, z
00215      {BMO_OP_SLOT_BOOL,        "mirror_u"}, //mirror UVs across the u axis
00216      {BMO_OP_SLOT_BOOL,        "mirror_v"}, //mirror UVs across the v axis
00217      {0, /* null-terminating sentinel */}},
00218     bmo_mirror_exec,
00219     0,
00220 };
00221 
00222 /*
00223  * Find Doubles
00224  *
00225  * Takes input verts and find vertices they should weld to.  Outputs a
00226  * mapping slot suitable for use with the weld verts bmop.
00227  *
00228  * If keepverts is used, vertices outside that set can only be merged
00229  * with vertices in that set.
00230  */
00231 static BMOpDefine bmo_finddoubles_def = {
00232     "finddoubles",
00233     {{BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "verts"}, //input vertices
00234      {BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "keepverts"}, //list of verts to keep
00235      {BMO_OP_SLOT_FLT,         "dist"}, //minimum distance
00236      {BMO_OP_SLOT_MAPPING, "targetmapout"},
00237      {0, /* null-terminating sentinel */}},
00238     bmo_finddoubles_exec,
00239     0,
00240 };
00241 
00242 /*
00243  * Remove Doubles
00244  *
00245  * Finds groups of vertices closer then dist and merges them together,
00246  * using the weld verts bmop.
00247  */
00248 static BMOpDefine bmo_removedoubles_def = {
00249     "removedoubles",
00250     {{BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "verts"}, //input verts
00251      {BMO_OP_SLOT_FLT,         "dist"}, //minimum distance
00252      {0, /* null-terminating sentinel */}},
00253     bmo_removedoubles_exec,
00254     BMO_OP_FLAG_UNTAN_MULTIRES,
00255 };
00256 
00257 /*
00258  * Auto Merge
00259  *
00260  * Finds groups of vertices closer then dist and merges them together,
00261  * using the weld verts bmop.  The merges must go from a vert not in
00262  * verts to one in verts.
00263  */
00264 static BMOpDefine bmo_automerge_def = {
00265     "automerge",
00266     {{BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "verts"}, //input verts
00267      {BMO_OP_SLOT_FLT,         "dist"}, //minimum distance
00268      {0, /* null-terminating sentinel */}},
00269     bmo_automerge_exec,
00270     BMO_OP_FLAG_UNTAN_MULTIRES,
00271 };

00343 /*
00344  * Weld Verts
00345  *
00346  * Welds verts together (kindof like remove doubles, merge, etc, all of which
00347  * use or will use this bmop).  You pass in mappings from vertices to the vertices
00348  * they weld with.
00349  */
00350 static BMOpDefine bmo_weldverts_def = {
00351     "weldverts",
00352     {{BMO_OP_SLOT_MAPPING, "targetmap"}, /* maps welded vertices to verts they should weld to */
00353      {0, /* null-terminating sentinel */}},
00354     bmo_weldverts_exec,
00355     BMO_OP_FLAG_UNTAN_MULTIRES,
00356 };

00367      {BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "newvertout"}, //the new vert

00369     bmo_makevert_exec,
00370     0,
00371 };

00373 /*
00374  * Join Triangles
00375  *
00376  * Tries to intelligently join triangles according
00377  * to various settings and stuff.
00378  */
00379 static BMOpDefine bmo_join_triangles_def = {
00380     "join_triangles",
00381     {{BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "faces"}, //input geometry.
00382      {BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "faceout"}, //joined faces
00383      {BMO_OP_SLOT_BOOL, "cmp_sharp"},
00384      {BMO_OP_SLOT_BOOL, "cmp_uvs"},
00385      {BMO_OP_SLOT_BOOL, "cmp_vcols"},
00386      {BMO_OP_SLOT_BOOL, "cmp_materials"},
00387      {BMO_OP_SLOT_FLT, "limit"},
00388      {0, /* null-terminating sentinel */}},
00389     bmo_join_triangles_exec,
00390     BMO_OP_FLAG_UNTAN_MULTIRES,
00391 };

00393 /*
00394  * Contextual Create
00395  *
00396  * This is basically fkey, it creates
00397  * new faces from vertices, makes stuff from edge nets,
00398  * makes wire edges, etc.  It also dissolves
00399  * faces.
00400  *
00401  * Three verts become a triangle, four become a quad.  Two
00402  * become a wire edge.
00403  */
00404 static BMOpDefine bmo_contextual_create_def = {
00405     "contextual_create",
00406     {{BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "geom"}, //input geometry.
00407      {BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "faceout"},     /* newly-made face(s) */
00408      {BMO_OP_SLOT_INT,         "mat_nr"},      /* material to use */
00409      {BMO_OP_SLOT_BOOL,        "use_smooth"},  /* material to use */
00410      {0, /* null-terminating sentinel */}},
00411     bmo_contextual_create_exec,
00412     BMO_OP_FLAG_UNTAN_MULTIRES,
00413 };
00414 
00415 /*
00416  * Bridge edge loops with faces
00417  */
00418 static BMOpDefine bmo_bridge_loops_def = {
00419     "bridge_loops",
00420     {{BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "edges"}, /* input edge */
00421      {BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "faceout"}, /* new face */
00422      {0, /* null-terminating sentinel */}},
00423     bmo_bridge_loops_exec,
00424     0,
00425 };

00427 static BMOpDefine bmo_edgenet_fill_def = {
00428     "edgenet_fill",
00429     {{BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "edges"}, /* input edge */
00430      {BMO_OP_SLOT_MAPPING,     "restrict"}, /* restricts edges to groups.  maps edges to integer */
00431      {BMO_OP_SLOT_BOOL,        "use_restrict"},
00432      {BMO_OP_SLOT_BOOL,        "use_fill_check"},
00433      {BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "excludefaces"}, /* list of faces to ignore for manifold check */
00434      {BMO_OP_SLOT_MAPPING,     "faceout_groupmap"}, /* maps new faces to the group numbers they came fro */
00435      {BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "faceout"},     /* new face */
00436      {BMO_OP_SLOT_INT,         "mat_nr"},      /* material to use */
00437      {BMO_OP_SLOT_BOOL,        "use_smooth"},  /* material to use */
00438      {0, /* null-terminating sentinel */}},
00439     bmo_edgenet_fill_exec,
00440     0,
00441 };

00443 /*
00444  * Edgenet Prepare
00445  *
00446  * Identifies several useful edge loop cases and modifies them so
00447  * they'll become a face when edgenet_fill is called.  The cases covered are:
00448  *
00449  * - One single loop; an edge is added to connect the ends
00450  * - Two loops; two edges are added to connect the endpoints (based on the
00451  *   shortest distance between each endpont).
00452  */
00453 static BMOpDefine bmo_edgenet_prepare_def = {
00454     "edgenet_prepare",
00455     {{BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "edges"}, //input edges
00456      {BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "edgeout"}, //new edges
00457      {0, /* null-terminating sentinel */}},
00458     bmo_edgenet_prepare,
00459     0,
00460 };
00461 
00462 /*
00463  * Rotate
00464  *
00465  * Rotate vertices around a center, using a 3x3 rotation
00466  * matrix.  Equivalent of the old rotateflag function.
00467  */
00468 static BMOpDefine bmo_rotate_def = {
00469     "rotate",
00470     {{BMO_OP_SLOT_VEC, "cent"}, //center of rotation
00471      {BMO_OP_SLOT_MAT, "mat"}, //matrix defining rotation
00472      {BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF, "verts"}, //input vertices
00473      {0, /* null-terminating sentinel */}},
00474     bmo_rotate_exec,
00475     0,
00476 };
